socks_h.help1Txt1: The Axis product can be configured to use a SOCKS server to reach networks on the other side of a firewall/proxy server. This functionality is useful if the product is located on a local network behind a firewall, but notifications, uploads, alarms, etc., need to be sent to a destination outside the local network (e.g. to the Internet).
socks_h.help1Txt2: The SOCKS server handles requests from clients inside the company firewall and either allows or rejects connection requests, based on the requested destination or user identification. Once the connection has been approved and set up, it will then continue, using a standard protocol, for example, HTTP.
socks_h.help4Txt: Enable SOCKS - This must be checked to use the SOCKS protocol.
socks_h.help5Txt: Server - Enter the host name or IP address of the server providing the SOCKS service. If using a host name, a DNS server must be specified in the
socks_h.help6Txt: Server port - Enter the TCP port number used by the SOCKS server. This is usually 1080.
socks_h.help7Txt: Server type - Select the type of SOCKS server. Version 5 supports a number of authentication functions not supported by version 4.
socks_h.help8Txt1: Local networks - The networks entered here are those that are not required to go via the SOCKS server. The default values are the standard local IP address series.
socks_h.help8Txt2: Local networks are always entered in the format IP-address/subnet-mask, e.g. 192.168.0.0/255.255.255.0
socks_h.help9Txt: User name - If using user authentication on a SOCKS5 server, enter the user name here.
socks_h.help10Txt: Password - Enter the password associated with the user name above. Note that the password is not encrypted at any point, either in the unit or when transmitted to the SOCKS server.
socks_h.reboot_deviceNote_Txt: Note: The Axis product must be restarted after enabling SOCKS.
